search_results.snippet: The ng (/d/; Vietnamese: [m]; sign: ; code: VND) has been the currency of Vietnam since May 3, 1978. Issued by the State Bank of Vietnam, it is represented by the symbol "". Formerly, it was subdivided into 10 ho, which was further subdivided into 10 xu, neither of which is now used.
